required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MORAb-003 in Patients With Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study of MORAb-003 in Patients With Solid Tumor

brief_summary.textblock: MORAb-003 is intravenously administered to Japanese patients with folate receptor-alpha expressing solid tumor once a week for 4 weeks as 1 cycle in order to investigate dose-limiting toxicity and estimate maximum tolerated dose.

primary_outcome.measure: To investigate dose-limiting toxicity and estimate maximum tolerated dose.

clinical_study.condition: Patients With a Folate-receptor Alpha Expressing Solid Tumor Who Are Not Responsive or Resistant to Standard Therapy and Have no Other Appropriate Treatment.

intervention.description: MORAb-003 is intravenously administered to patients with solid tumor once a week for 4 weeks as 1 cycle in order to investigate dose-limiting toxicity and estimate maximum tolerated dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria;
1. Japanese male and female aged >or=20 to <80 years at obtaining informed consent
2. Patient with histologically or cytologically diagnosed solid tumor
3. Patient who is FRα-positive confirmed by immunohistochemistry (IHC) (except for ovarian cancer that FRα-positive is frequently reported)
4. Patients with a folate-receptor alpha expressing solid tumor who are not responsive or resistant to standard therapy and have no other appropriate treatment
5. Performance Status (PS) is 0 to 1 by Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group（ECOG）criteria
Exclusion criteria
1. Brain metastasis presenting clinical symptoms or requiring medical treatment
2. Serious and systemic infection requiring medical treatment
3. History of hypersensitivity to protein formulations including monoclonal antibody
4. With other active malignancy (except for carcinoma in situ)
5. With a large volume of pleural effusion or ascites requiring drainage
